title: Server for The Dos Vault is a reality
content:
damn ezboard, my older topic about getting a server was deleted, i wish xtra would stop being a fusspot & just move the pckf (no offense xtra), anyway i have some good news, the server for the dos vault is a reality (which means i will soon move the tdv off the ad-ridden free server & onto a ad-free server, the great news is that i will have about 1GB of webspace & a phpbb board (which i had a while ago until spaceports shutdown all free accounts) & djaser this will be the absolutely last time i will move the forum plus i am considering a name change for the new forum when it's setup, cos djaser insits that a games forum that discuss new & old games so it's only fitting that the dos vault forum be renamed to something else

post anything what u think will look good on the new server[url=http://www.dosvault.tk][img]http://venus.walagata.com/w/thedosvault/sig/tdv_banner.jpg[/img][/url]

WIPE OUT BUSH! WIPE OUT HOWARD!

title: Re: Server for The Dos Vault is a reality
content:
It's not entirely xtra's desicion to move the PCKF, you know. Chog'all owns the boards and eK would want a say in whether the boards move as well. Democracy takes time. (And so does moving.)
My [url=http://kevan.org/brain.cgi?grafix5000]MindBending Power[/url] is 5.43 points.
Possibly the [url=http://legion.gibbering.net/misterx/troutwar.php?s=grafix5000]funniest thing[/url] on the interweb.
Go to [url=http://www.toxicsheep.com]www.toxicsheep.com[/url] to see my site!

content:

Chog'all, where are you?

Oh, and good, rorie.You hear in your mind: GAAARRRRRGG!

title: Re: Server for The Dos Vault is a reality
content:

The problem is I have the feeling that nobody really cares about it, well maybe Keenrush en Xtraverse but the rest does not. I don't blame them for not caring about it because we all have our lives but it slows down the development for the forum, because there is still something like democracy and I do blame them for that. '

title: Re: Server for The Dos Vault is a reality
content:
i know this topic is old & i shouldn't really dig it out
but the server is ready, i just need to re-design the site using tables, & register the domain

which sounds better http://www.dosvault.com or http://www.dosvault.com.au

i am also going to rename the forum when the phpbb is setup so that it will be suitable to discuss modern & classic games

if you are wondering on what happended 2 the invisionfree board, i closed it cos it had been a few years since i opened it & it had no traffic for a long time[url=http://www.ironmaiden.com][img]http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/en/thumb/e/eb/Iron_Stick_800.jpg/250px-Iron_Stick_800.jpg[/img]

title: Re: Server for The Dos Vault is a reality
content:
Hey Naj, who's "Malvaneous"? [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-cheeky.gif[/img]

And that's not a bad deal Rorie, I registered shikadi.net from [url=http://www.netregistry.com.au]NetRegistry[/url] which was the cheapest place I could find at the time, but they're a little more expensive than Quost. Although their domain management is pretty good, so you might want to make sure you'll be able to do what you want with the domain before you go ahead and buy it. (e.g. some places won't let you create subdomains - you know, those things Najawa has gone crazy with on his domain.)

title: Re: Server for The Dos Vault is a reality
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr](e.g. some places won't let you create subdomains - you know, those things Najawa has gone crazy with on his domain.)[hr][/quote]
Usually, that's handled by the web host rather than the domain registrar. (This does not apply to subdomains that are used for their actual intended purpose, which pointing to individual machines connected to the internet)[url=http://last.fm/users/grafix5000/][img]http://toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobbler.png[/img][/url]

title: Re: Server for The Dos Vault is a reality
content:
[quote]Quote:[hr]also i beleive they bring nothing but trouble[hr][/quote]
Using credit cards online, or in general? Credit cards are very useful - especially for buying expensive items that you want purchase protection on, such as computers - but it's a bad idea to rely on them for day-to-day finances. If you don't plan to buy anything expensive, there's no point having one. (It's still a very good idea to have some sort of electronic payment, though - I have a debit card which I would have trouble living without)[url=http://last.fm/users/grafix5000/][img]http://toxicsheep.com/sigs/scrobbler.png[/img][/url]
